subject: Re: Finally a reply
msgSnippet: ... Yeah, that s been my problem trying to learn symbols 32-34 (y, Y, o). My problem is, for example, in some words, I can t distinguish the Ah and Ox sounds
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@y..., Robert McBroom wrote:
> So the question remains, "Which authoritative accent will the QS
> dictionary accept?" The Read community has wisely been been loath
> to try to set up any accent as more acceptable than another.

Yeah, that's been my problem trying to learn symbols 32-34 (y, Y, o). My problem is, for example, in some words, I can't distinguish the Ah and Ox sounds easily. Also, my accent is the result of a Canadian being mostly raised in Eastern North Carolina (mostly Piney Wood accent). So I pronounce the L in words like calm and talk. I can't seem to train myself to write tYk instead of tylk.

If I were writing only in my personal notes (which I plan to do), it wouldn't be a big problem. But seeing as there's a real community of Read folks, I can't always just write exactly as I speak.

I guess my question is: Would I still be understood and is it a problem?

--
/rE /bDk

--- In Read_Alphabet@y..., Robert McBroom  wrote:
> So the question remains, "Which authoritative accent will the QS 
> dictionary accept?"  The Read community has wisely been been loath
> to try to set up any accent as more acceptable than another.

Yeah, that's been my problem trying to learn symbols 32-34 (y, Y, o). My problem is, for example, in some words, I can't distinguish the Ah and Ox sounds easily. Also, my accent is the result of a Canadian being mostly raised in Eastern North Carolina (mostly Piney Wood accent). So I pronounce the L in words like calm and talk. I can't seem to train myself to write tYk instead of tylk.

If I were writing only in my personal notes (which I plan to do), it wouldn't be a big problem. But seeing as there's a real community of Read folks, I can't always just write exactly as I speak.

I guess my question is: Would I still be understood and is it a problem?

--

<p>If I were writing only in my personal notes (which I plan to do), it wouldn't be a big problem. But seeing as there's a real community of Read folks, I can't always just write exactly as I speak.</p>
